column3: I am not sure if version Ubuntu Trusty 14.04 pulls in the Windows %PATH% variable? I am using the latest  Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 which has more issues cross compiling as mentioned in #10269 . If 14.04 does not pull in %PATH% thus not causing the issue this doc addition tries to fix then please reject this PR.\n\nThanks.
> I am not sure if version Ubuntu Trusty 14.04 pulls in the Windows %PATH% variable?\n\nNot sure either, it doesn't hurt to add the step in any case, it will likely still be needed for 18.04.

Started testing this.
Built master at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/c22a53cd6351b3f0e96de971b001ad712b83fc47 on a Windows 10 VM (Version 1607, OS Build 14393.1593) using WSL with Ubuntu 14.04.
![windows](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/30195033-867f1f24-9489-11e7-932c-e87b8764a627.png)

Going to upgrade to Ubuntu 16.04/10 and test.

Upgraded WSL to 16.04.3, and tried building https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/c22a53cd6351b3f0e96de971b001ad712b83fc47 using these instructions. The result is as expected.
![ubuntu 16 04 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/30235670-b9bf36bc-953d-11e7-8c1d-4debf7113032.png)


Upgraded WSL to 17.04 and tried building https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/3255d6347

@donaloconnor I'd like to cherry-pick this commit, but I can't seem to as the author info is missing. 
```
bitcoin xxx$ git cherry-pick 6e6ee9e83c35189fc98da5461633ef8aa5aa5879
fatal: empty ident name (for <user@xxx.localdomain>) not allowed
```

Could you either push up a commit with author information, or do you mind if I take the changes as they are, and credit you in my new commit?
@donaloconnor Thanks. Closing this PR in favour of #11437.
